The character which the film "documents" through a hand-held video camera, is Rob, a New Yorker about to leave for Japan to take up a vice-chairman position. This present story is recorded over a previous taping of Rob's day with childhood friend Beth. Through the little snippets that have not been recorded over, it can be deciphered that they have spent a night together and the situation between them is now awkward. Are they just friends? Is Rob willing to stay in New York? Things are unresolved and Beth leaves in a huff.

This is when the story takes a turn. An explosion resembling an earthquake shatters through the city. As the party makes its way onto the street, the head of the Statue of Liberty crashes onto the street. A terrifying cry of echoes in the air, signifying that this is the act of a living thing rather than an earthquake or terrorist act. As the city is being evacuated, Rob receives a distress call from Beth. Along with Hud, his best friend-cum-cameraman, his brother's girlfriend and Hud's love interest, they make their way back to Cloverfield, where Beth's apartment is. Why does he go back for someone who is not even officially his girlfriend? Not to give away anything in terms of plot, I can only say it's hard to see someone you love die, but it's worse to leave someone to die without her knowing you love her.

What happens next is for you to find out. As I left the cinema, I noticed that the majority of the viewers seemed disappointed at how the movie turned out. Just look past the set expectations that a genre carries with it, suspend your disbelief and enjoy a film that will be a classic that is representative of our time.

title: This is the beginning...
review: This has to be the beginning of a new franchise of movies. This was awesome, I want to see what happened before and after this hand held camcorder film was shot. Go see it, and remember this is done by a hand held camcorder. But worth the pain of seeing it that way. The thing I enjoyed was that this could happen, not like Transformers. This is exactly what I wouldn't ever want to happen to the world. But wow it makes you really wonder. The director did a fantastic job. I love his movies for the most part, this was top notch. Hurry and send the real movie to print and lets get this party started quickly... I will pay to see this movie again and again. I'm taking the wife to see it again tomorrow when everyones at church.

title: the most shocking experience in my life!!! ill see it again.
review: WOW!!! This has to be the most amazing experience I've had in a while. I have been waiting six and a half months for this and its lived up to the hype. My pulse was crazy i felt short of breath and loved it. to make a movie where you feel like your apart of it and then there was the emotional aspect. When rob had to tell his mom about Jason my girl friend cried and i felt awful. The experience is one you absolutely need to experience at the theater. i was shocked at the crowd when they booed it i yelled go waste your money on meet the spartans you dumb red necks. I hope there will be a sequel to this movie and i will go see this movie again and again buy it on blu ray or HD DVD when it comes out and look for clues through out. its a must see

title: Awesome!!
review:
I've always loved the cheesy old monster movies. This one is not at all cheesy - which made the experience that much newer and better.

The shaky camera and the fact that you're following a group of ordinary people trying first to escape and then rescue a missing friend while a partially and unpredictably seen monster rampages draws you into the story and holds on tight. Completely unlike most other "monster destroys city" movies - you feel this one is real and happening right in front of you.

I will admit that I'm tired of the indestructible Godzilla-ish monster and would have preferred that we appeared to be able to do at least a little damage to it, but I guess it's meaner if all the firepower in the military can't hurt it.

Enjoy the crap out of this one and hope they find another camera somewhere with another perspective on the story. Cloverfield 2, please.
